solution_line_template: The tickets for both of her brothers will cost her ${brother_ticket_cost} * {num_brothers} = $<<{brother_ticket_cost}*{num_brothers}={total_brother_tickets}>>{total_brother_tickets}.
To buy tickets for all of them, it will cost Isabelle ${isabelle_ticket_cost} + ${total_brother_tickets} = $<<{isabelle_ticket_cost}+{total_brother_tickets}={total_ticket_cost}>>{total_ticket_cost}.
Between all of them, they have saved a total of ${brothers_saved} + ${isabelle_saved} = $<<{brothers_saved}+{isabelle_saved}={total_saved}>>{total_saved}.

Since they have already saved ${total_saved}, she needs to earn an additional ${total_ticket_cost} - ${total_saved} = $<<{additional_needed}={additional_needed}>>{additional_needed} to afford the tickets.

Since she makes ${weekly_pay} per week, it will take her ${additional_needed} / (${weekly_pay}/week) = <<{additional_needed}/({weekly_pay})={weeks_needed}>>{weeks_needed} weeks to save enough money for all of the tickets.
